  Summary 

public class  ExecuteCmdWindow
     extends java.awt.Frame
{
          // Constructors 1
     public ExecuteCmdWindow();

          // Methods 5
     public void close();
     protected void describeCommand();
     protected void executeCommand(Event);
     public boolean getCmd(Event, Object);
     public boolean handleEvent(Event);
}

The ExecuteCmdWindow lists out several Cmds that the user can execute by clicking on the Cmd name. This allows programmers to add new Cmds without having to work out where exactly in the interface to put it, and allows users to execute Cmds without having to know the right keystrokes or get into the proper mode. Users can also see on-line help for each Cmd from this list. FEATURE: execute_cmd_window FEATURE: view_cmd_documentation
